title: Bug 38131ajc needs d . option while correctly compiling classes from subpackage
OB: When compiling a class in a subpackage using ajc (AspectJ compiler), the resulting test.class file is placed in a subpackage\\subpackage directory. As a result, when running the java command, an exception is thrown: 'Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test'.
EB: The test.class file should be put in the subpackage directory instead of subpackage\\subpackage directory, so that running the java command does not result in a 'NoClassDefFoundError: subpackage/Test' exception.
SR:
To reproduce:
1. Create a class in a subpackage.
2. Compile the class using the command 'ajc subpackage\\Test.java'.
3. Run the java command on the compiled class.
